intro: Topobea anisophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed topobea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to South America, particularly in regions of Chile and Argentina. Topobea anisophylla is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
